title: ‘Zombie Boy’ Rick Genest’s death ruled ‘accidental’
text:
Rick Genest’s death has been ruled accidental

‘Zombie Boy’ Rick Genest’s death has been ruled an ‘accident’ by the coroner this week, more than a year after he died.

In August 2018 the Montreal model died after he fell off a balcony and sustained head trauma.

Today coroner Mélissa Gagnon announced her findings, reporting in her notes Genest died after sustaining a fatal head injury.

He was found ‘unconcious and bleeding’ at the foot of a building after falling from a friend’s third-storey apartment in the city’s Plateau-Mont-Royal borough.

According to local news, the coroner found Genest’s blood-alcohol level was 234 mg/dL (for reference, the legal limit to drive a vehicle is 80 mg/dL in the UK). The corner said cannabis was also detected in his blood.

Rick died in August 2018 (Picture: FilmMagic)

During the police investigation, it was previously reported he may have died by suicide, however friends and family denied suggestions.

Genest’s manager Karim Leduc said on Monday following the findings: ‘Rick was always somebody who had a lot of ambition, he was someone who had a lot of ideas for new projects and certainly we had things scheduled. It made absolutely no sense.’

However, Gagnon mentioned in her report that she cannot rule out suicide when it comes to the performer’s death.

She added, though, Genest ‘did not seem to be in a state of psychosis or delirium when he went out on the balcony to smoke’.

Gagnon concluded: ‘After analysis, given that the investigation did not reveal a clear and unequivocal intention to end his life on Mr Genest’s part, I cannot state that the death was a suicide.’

Adding of the accidental nature she found, the coroner continued: ‘Some of Mr Genest’s close friends indicated that he had a habit of sitting on the railing of the building’s balcony when he went out to smoke.’

The model rose to international fame thanks to his striking tattoos, which gave him the appearance of a corpse, and his appearance in Lady Gaga’s Born This Way video.

Genest also starred in a number of movies including 47 Ronin opposite Keanu Reeves.
